relating to the metre (= rhythm) of a piece of poetry: Old English poetry used a metrical pattern with different numbers of syllables but a fixed number of strong stresses in each line.
More examplesFewer examplesPoets express their feelings within tight metrical structures.Metrical psalms are still sometimes used in Baptist churches.The poet uses metrical verse.Biblical poetry does not rely on metrical feet to create rhythm.
